name: Start/Prompt
text:
[Your original prompt, for example: I am an 11th grade student who is preparing for a biology test on cellular energetics including photosynthesis. I need to know about enzymes and energy. I need to be able to explain diagrams (e.g. Calvin Cycle, Krebs Cycle, factors effective photosynthesis etc).]
Not only do I need to learn this material, but I would also like to periodically take metacognition breaks where I will prompt you to help me think about my thinking so I can 1) better learn and recall this information and also 2) learn new concepts more deeply and efficiently in the future.

name: A1
text: What do I already know about this subject matter?

name: A2
text: How can I break up the skills I need to learn this topic into several containers that can help me bundle the topics and break my learning down into manageable chunks. Right now I am not asking about content, just skills.

name: A3
text: How can I break up the content I need to learn into several containers that can help me bundle the topics and break my learning down into manageable chunks. Right now I am not asking about skills, just content.

name: A4
text: What do I think my strengths/weaknesses are in this area of learning? How can I play to my strengths and shore up my weaknesses?

name: A5
text: What goals should I set for both myself and you (the AI) to ensure effective collaboration? How should I allocate my study time between independent learning and using AI assistance to maximize efficiency?

name: A6
text: What can I delegate to you (the AI), and what do I need to do myself?

name: P1
text: Am I staying focused on both skill and content development while I’m learning with AI? How can I ensure I do this?

name: P2
text: What learning strategies can I employ in addition to using AI to deepen my comprehension of the material?

name: P3
text: What challenges might I face in terms of how well I can learn and recall the information about this topic?

name: M1
text: How will I monitor my understanding and progress throughout this session? And when will I adjust my plan if needed?

name: M2
text: In this conversation, are you (AI) providing feedback to improve my learning? How can I use it more effectively?

name: M3
text: Are your (the AI’s) responses successfully meeting my expectations? How can I adjust my instructions and feedback to improve your responses?

name: M4
text: What assumptions am I making about this topic and my knowledge and skills? Are these getting in the way of my learning?

name: E1a
text: Compare and contrast this topic/concept with a topic I learned previously in this course

name: E1b
text: Please provide an acronym and an analogy to help me remember topic/concept

name: E2a
text: How can I apply what I learned in this session to future tasks or subjects?

name: E2b
text: Provide a real world example of this topic in action and ask me to evaluate it based on what I learned

name: E3
text: Design a rubric to evaluate whether or not I understand this topic. Provide questions for me to answer about the topic and then use this rubric to evaluate my learning and growth

name: E4
text: What were my strengths and weaknesses learning about this topic? Give specific examples. How does this compare to what I reported at the beginning of this conversation?

name: E5
text: Did I show any biases or fall into any thinking traps?

name: E6
text: What feedback did I receive, and did I use it to improve my understanding of how I learn? What did I miss?

name: E7
text: Did I rely too much on you (the AI) to learn and develop skills? How do I strike the right balance?

name: E8
text: Check the above transcript for evidence of metacognition (or a lack thereof) and provide examples.
